line_1: Mark, my Polly, how the roses
line_2: How the bud its sweets discloses,
Cause a sensation in our noses;

line_1: Makes Cheeks fair, where no Lillies grow nor Roses,
Makes Cheeks fair, where no Lillies grow nor Roses,
line_2: And Women beautiful that want their Noses:

line_1: In vain the lillies bloom, or roses,
line_2: In whose soft down while he reposes

line_1: They surely smell to nought but roses;
line_2: And, though we see they carry noses,
